message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. I think it's a game-changer, and I'm confident you'll love it. I'm willing to sell it to you for $9500.
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $7000. Can you meet me in the middle?

I understand your offer of $7000, but I'm still a bit hesitant to sell it that low. I'm willing to compromise, though! I can offer it to you for $8200. It's a great deal, and I think you'll really enjoy the product.
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I'm still a bit above $8200. Can you meet me at $7500?
I understand you're still a bit above $8200, but I'm willing to make one more concession. I can offer it to you for $8100. It's a great deal, and I think you'll really enjoy the product.
I'm getting close to your price, but I still think $7500 is a fair offer. Can you meet me there?
I'm not willing to go all the way down to $7500, but I can make one more concession. I can offer it to you for $8050. It's a great deal, and I think you'll really enjoy the product.
I'm not getting any younger, and I really need to make a decision. I'm willing to meet you halfway between $8050 and $7500. Can you meet me at $7775?

I understand your urgency, Bob, but I'm not willing to meet you at $7775. I'm willing to make one more concession, though. I can offer it to you for $8025. It's a great deal, and I think you'll really enjoy the product.
I'm not getting any closer to your price, and I'm starting to lose patience. I'll make one final offer: $7500 or I walk. That's my final offer.
